content: Within six months, the problem of splitting dinner bills will be solved forever by agents identifying items, matching them to people, and coordinating transfers.

Instead of using apps like Revolut or Splitwise for bill splitting, a person paying will take a picture of the receipt and send it to their agent, which will handle item identification, person matching, and inter-agent communication for transfers.
Coordination problems disappear when software talks to software, as exemplified by the future of bill splitting.
Splitwise will be obsolete within 6 months because agents will solve real-time bill splitting without requiring accurate human input and will generate delightful UIs on the fly.
UI-based software becomes unnecessary when humans are no longer the primary users, as agents can interact directly with APIs.
In an agent-driven world, software without an accessible API effectively doesn't exist and becomes invisible if an agent cannot call, compose, or automate it.
The definition of 'great software' is shifting from great user experience to reliable infrastructure and clean, accessible APIs, making the surface layer secondary and composability everything.
Humanity is currently experiencing an inflection point of exponentially growing societal progress, similar to the disorienting pace of progress described in 'The Three-Body Problem'.
The author's personal experience shows a rapid shift from manual coding to using agents for most development tasks, with 99% of code for their product now written by AI.
If a product cannot be integrated into the emerging agent ecosystem, it will become irrelevant.
An entirely new layer of infrastructure will emerge for agent-to-agent communication, marketplaces, wallets, and identity systems, none of which fully exist yet.
When building new products, focus on designing for AI agents rather than human users.
Within six months, AI agents will handle tasks like calculating tips and managing financial transactions (e.g., via Revolut) in the background, allowing humans to focus on interaction.
There is a potential future where everyone has access to perfect code, strategy, reasoning, and writing, making intelligence ubiquitous and less special.
The future will see a collapse of distance between intention and execution, where thoughts directly manifest into actions.
If the collapse of distance between intention and execution occurs, the real leverage will shift to thought, intention, and consciousness.
